alert.note: Alert for Eagle; Garfield; Pitkin (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GrandJunction (Western Colorado and Eastern Utah)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued February 11 at 2:13PM MST by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY FOR AN ICE JAM IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM MST MONDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by an ice jam is expected. * WHERE...The Roaring Fork River in portions of northwest Colorado and west central Colorado, including the following counties, in northwest Colorado, Eagle and Garfield. In west central Colorado, Pitkin. * WHEN...Until 600 PM MST Monday. * IMPACTS...Anglers and anyone near or in the Roaring Fork River should use extreme caution and be on the lookout for ice and debris flowing in the river. Move away from the river and seek higher ground. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 207 PM MST, observers reported surface ice accumulating through Snowmass Canyon and on the lower Frying Pan River. Minor flooding is possible if an ice jam is released.
info.instruction: Emergency management and law enforcement are asking all citizens to use extreme caution in and around the Roaring Fork River.
